entry.title: Nutrition Class Review
entry.summary: This blog post was written as an assignment for this class. However, this will not affect my review of this class.
entry.content:
note

This blog post was written as an assignment for this class. However, this will not affect my review of this class.

From August 2025 to December 2025, I was enrolled in a class called "Man's Food." Despite the name, I will refer to this class as a "nutrition class" because that is what stuck out to me the most about this class.

Why Did I Take This Class?​

As much as I would love to say that I enrolled in it for the love of food, my primary reason for taking this class was because I needed General Education credits for my major (Computer Science!). Due to this fact, I was very skeptical with whether or not I would even enjoy this class because I don't really like biology-related content.

However, after completing the entire course, I can confidently say that I enjoy this class now!

What Did I Know Before Taking This Class?​

Before taking this class, my general knowledge of "nutrition" was relatively general. I was aware that to eat healthy, one must eat a balanced diet of vegetables, fruits, grains, proteins, and dairy. But, I never paid too much attention to it because nutrition advice always seemed confusing. Prior to this class, nutrition advice seemed to be a long list of commandments that must be obeyed, unless you wanted to suffer long-term consequences.

However, I can confidently say that this class has gotten rid a lot of confusion that I had regarding nutrition-related advice. It also has made me pay much more attention to what I eat and to eat healthier!

The biggest reason for this is because the course requires you to build a meal plan of what you will eat during a given week. The assignment originally required me to use AI to generate a meal plan at first. However, I later refined it to better fit my needs.

My Nutritional Needs​

https://www.myplate.gov/myplate-plan/

My Meal Plan​

The table below shows the current meal plan that I follow every week.

MealMondayTuesdayWednesdayThursdayFridaySaturdaySunday
BreakfastOats + AppleEggs + ToastOats + AppleEggs + ToastOats + AppleCereal + Milk + AppleApple
LunchRice + Chicken + VeggiesRice + Ham + VeggiesRice + Chicken + VeggiesRice + Ham + VeggiesRice + Ham + VeggiesRice + Chicken + VeggiesRestaurant
DinnerPasta + Tomato SaucePasta + Tomato SaucePasta + Tomato SaucePasta + Tomato SaucePasta + Tomato SaucePasta + Tomato Sauce
